greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = number of irreducible polynomial factors (counted with multiplicity) in the n-th Stern polynomial B(n,t).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..85085
formula: It seems that for all n >= 1, a(2^n) = n.
example: B(11,t) = t^2 + 3t + 1 which is irreducible, so a(11) = 1.
program: ps(n) = if(n<2, n, if(n%2, ps(n\2)+ps(n\2+1), 'x*ps(n\2))); \\ From _Charles R Greathouse IV_ code in A186891.
xref: Cf. A186891 (positions of 0 and 1's in this sequence), A277027 (terms squared).
Differs from A001222 for the first time at n=25, where a(25)=1. A277190 gives the positions of differing terms.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 07 2016
